abstract.text: Returns information about a security context.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to the secondary status result that provides additional information in case of failure.
The context to obtain information about.
A pointer the function uses to return the name of the initiator. Free the name object’s memory with a call to
when you are done with it. Specify
to ignore this output.
A pointer the function uses to return the name of the acceptor. Free the name object’s memory with a call to
when you are done with it. Specify
to ignore this output.
A pointer the function uses to return the number of seconds before the context expires, or zero if it has already expired. If the context does not support expiration, it returns
. Specify
to ignore this output.
A pointer the function uses to return the mechanism providing the context. Do not release the OID object, because it is held in static memory. Specify
to ignore this output.
A pointer the function uses to return the flags associated with the context. See
for a description of available flags. Specify NULL to ignore this output.

A pointer the function uses to return an indicator of the context’s point of origin. The value is zero when the function is called by context’s acceptor and non-zero otherwise. Specify NULL to ignore this output.
A pointer the function uses to return an indicator of the context’s current state. The value is non-zero when the context if fully established and zero otherwise. Specify NULL to ignore this output.
A status code set to
on success. See
for a description of other status outputs.
The context must exist but need not be fully established for the inquiry to succeed.

abstract.text: The value that indicates the maximum permitted lifetime when used in a time request.
Use context services to manage secure operations between endpoints.
Evaluate return values that most GSS-API functions use to indicate the outcome of an operation.
A pointer to the OID descriptor that exchanges object identifiers with many GSS-API functions.
Returns the amount of time remaining before a context expires.
A pointer to an opaque type that you use to communicate context pointers with GSS-API functions.
Returns information about a security context.
Returns information about a particular part of a context.
A pointer to an opaque type that you use to communicate name objects with GSS-API functions.
Frees the resources associated with a name object.
Returns the largest allowable wrap size for a given set of constraints.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
